description:
8.56 asoftclip
Apply audio soft clipping.

Soft clipping is a type of distortion effect where the amplitude of a signal is saturated
along a smooth curve, rather than the abrupt shape of hard-clipping.

This filter accepts the following options:

output.description: Set gain applied to output. Default value is 0dB or 1.

param.description: Set additional parameter which controls sigmoid function.

threshold.description: Set threshold from where to start clipping. Default value is 0dB or 1.

name: asoftclip

parameters.description:
Set type of soft-clipping.

It accepts the following values:

hard
tanh
atan
cubic
exp
alg
quintic
sin
erf
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: Set threshold from where to start clipping. Default value is 0dB or 1.
parameters.name: threshold

parameters.description: Set gain applied to output. Default value is 0dB or 1.
parameters.name: output

parameters.description: Set additional parameter which controls sigmoid function.
parameters.name: param

source:
8.56 asoftclip

Apply audio soft clipping.

Soft clipping is a type of distortion effect where the amplitude of a signal is saturated along a smooth curve, rather than the abrupt shape of hard-clipping.

This filter accepts the following options:

type

Set type of soft-clipping.

It accepts the following values:

hard
tanh
atan
cubic
exp
alg
quintic
sin
erf
threshold

Set threshold from where to start clipping. Default value is 0dB or 1.

output

Set gain applied to output. Default value is 0dB or 1.

param

Set additional parameter which controls sigmoid function.

oversample

Set oversampling factor.
